TopicTitle: A Munar Rover that straps to the LEM (Lotsa Pics)

Articles.Content:
Well i have been playing historical now for a while, and i was desperate to get a rover to the Mun, the way the Apollo missions did, the problem being that nobody seemed to have a Lunar rover that fit the bill, so Using Robotics, And some parts, I built one.

This is the Folded Rover being deployed.

After the rescue the Kerb seems very relieved!

The whole vehicle weighs in at 672 Pounds, and is very managable. The Wheels are the Munar Rover 1 wheels, other than that I think its all stock, cept for the generator .

NEXT i will attempt to make a Roll over part to flip it over if it flips.

Corporal Vasquez

USCSM / KSCSM 8th BMTS Sulaco.

hey im playing realistic too.

do u think u can get me the download for the rover its awesome btw

Well i have been playing historical now for a while, and i was desperate to get a rover to the Mun, the way the Apollo missions did, the problem being that nobody seemed to have a Lunar rover that fit the bill, so Using Robotics, And some parts, I built one.

Here we see the Rovers strapped to the LEM, I had to use two for balance, and in the end it worked out as I flipped one some distance from the LEM and had to rescue the Kerb.

This is the Folded Rover being deployed.

The Rover Unfolded and ready to go!

After the rescue the Kerb seems very relieved!

The whole vehicle weighs in at 672 Pounds, and is very managable. The Wheels are the Munar Rover 1 wheels, other than that I think its all stock, cept for the generator .

NEXT i will attempt to make a Roll over part to flip it over if it flips.

Corporal Vasquez

USCSM / KSCSM 8th BMTS Sulaco.

When adding pics delete the on both ends of the BBCode - FYI its not needed to post
